title: Take Back ze Wharf!
name: Take Back ze Wharf!
description:
A Map by Madamegonzaga

C'mon baby, donut fear ze tourists! I lyke playing wif tourists, zat ain't so bad. San Francisco, TAKE BACK ZE WHARF!

properties.name: Best Panhandler Ever
properties.description: Posted by HundredflowersMany visitors to the Fisherman\'s Wharf have fallen prey to the most bizarre panhandlers I have ever seen. It\'s actually a team of panhandlers. One of the guys will catch folks\' attention by saying something to the effect of "psst" or "hey." Of course, human nature being what it is, people will look at him and try to figure out what is up. What they don\'t notice is his partner hiding behind the bushes, who takes the opportunity to jump out yelling something to the effect of "BOO!" and totally scaring the pants off of people. Then both men will bow and present their hats for a tip or some change. It\'s is totally amazing and bizarre and somehow it works thought I can\'t put my finger on why.

properties.name: Charms by the Bay
properties.description: Posted by WendolynePier 39, San Francisco CAWhenever I get dragged to the Wharf, I actually look forward to checking out the sweet little charms in this somewhat magical-seeming little store. If you can\'t find a token to mark an important event or a charm to represent your hopes and dreams for yourself or your loved ones here that you just can\'t leave behind, well then baby you don\'t need one! Fisherman\'s Wharf, Pier 39, Space 0-5 Phone: 415-399-0988 | Toll Free: 877-242-7648

properties.description: Posted by GarlynnThe Powell-Mason Cable Car Line runs from Powell & Market (Powell St. BART) to Fisherman\'s Wharf.

properties.name: Musee Mecanique
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers   Pier 45 Shed A at the end of Taylor Street, Fisherman\'s Wharf, San Francisco, CA The Musee Mecanique is frozen in time. One of the world\'s largest privately owned collections of mechanically operated musical instruments and antique arcade machines. I wonder what keeps Edward Galland Zelinsky (curator + collector) going? There seem to be a million player pianos simultaneously banging out ragtime piano melodies, small vignettes are acted out by cardboard puppet actors in the penny arcade machines, handcrank silent movies, a fat woman who laughs horribly for a nickel and the foreboding gypsy tarot reader that will tell your fortune by dropping you a little printed note. It might seem haunted in a good way, by whatever it is that animates the many machines and keeps them imbued with the spirit of the past. A good place to go on a rainy day, especially on a date.

properties.name: San Francisco Gold Company
properties.description: Posted by Madamegonzaga Pier 39, San Francisco CA Ze nice jaunt tou Fisherman\'s Wharf should allways include ze veezit tou ze jewelie shoppes! Mein recent veezit wif Rebekah und Miss Leeeesa led us tou fynde ze spinnning rings, witch were introduced in San Francisco und witch Rebekah had nivver afore peeeped. Shee fluffed zem spinning rings und az fart az I nose, eez still in zat store drooooooolin\' on \'em. Yay Ringies! Noel Gervais, whom yoooo may hav seen dancing lyke John Travolta long agooooo on Dick Clark\'s American Bandstand or perhaps tippy-tapping on James Gabbert\'s Dance Party baxxx in ze 80s, und heez coworkinger Roland Yarni, wood love to help aryooo chooose ze perfect jewelie fur yore momma or eevin yore ho! Afterweirds, hav ze funnel cakey und get yore ass cabbage on up stares tou seee "Menopause: Ze Musakal" Now goose on und get yore elf ze diamond tou match ze sparklies in yore eyes! Fisherman\'s Wharf, Pier 39, SpaceP-4 e-mail fleeta-sfg@msn.com (415)421-2410

properties.name: San Francisco Maritime National Historical Park
properties.description: Posted by Madamegonzaga    Located at the west end of San Francisco\'s Fisherman\'s Wharf, this park includes the fleet of at Hyde Street Pier, a a and a Visitors can board turn-of-the-century ships, tour the museum and learn traditional arts -- like boatbuilding and woodworking. The Park offers educational, music and craft programs for all ages, and provides unique opportunities for docents, interns and volunteers to learn more about the nation\'s maritime heritage.
